notes.text:
An update for the httpd:2.4 module is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The httpd packages provide the Apache HTTP Server, a powerful, efficient, and extensible web server.

Security Fix(es):

* httpd: mod_session: NULL pointer dereference when parsing Cookie header (CVE-2021-26690)

* httpd: Unexpected URL matching with 'MergeSlashes OFF' (CVE-2021-30641)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.5 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: httpd:2.4 security, bug fix, and enhancement update

notes.text: A NULL pointer dereference was found in Apache httpd mod_session. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2021-26690 httpd: mod_session: NULL pointer dereference when parsing Cookie header
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This is a null pointer deference caused when using mod_session. It can result in crash of httpd child process by a remote attacker.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.

Only configurations which use the "SessionEnv" directive (which is not widely used) are vulnerable to this flaw. SessionEnv is not enabled in default configuration of httpd package shipped with Red Hat Products.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-26690 httpd: mod_session: NULL pointer dereference when parsing Cookie header

notes.text: A flaw was found in Apache httpd. A possible regression from an earlier security fix broke behavior of MergeSlashes. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data integrity.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: CVE-2021-30641 httpd: Unexpected URL matching with 'MergeSlashes OFF'
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This flaw was introduced when fixing https://access.redhat.com/security/cve/cve-2019-0220, therefore versions of httpd package shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, 8 and Red Hat Software Collections are affected by this flaw.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the updated packages, the httpd daemon will be restarted automatically.
This issue can be mitigated by setting the "MergeSlashes" directive to OFF

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2021-30641 httpd: Unexpected URL matching with 'MergeSlashes OFF'
